_sText:
***UPDATED 7-15-09 TO INCLUDE .RES FILE***


Map: cs_launch by Marshall

Counter-terrorist Objectives:
Hostages are being held at the missle silo.  Rescue them.  If unable to rescue, neutralize terrorist threats.

Terrorist Objectives:
Prevent hostages from being rescued.



CREDITS:

Author:
Keith M. Stephens - {MOUF}MarshaLL
email: mrsksteph@sbcglobal.net

Thanks to {MOUF}JCap334 and bluearctic.com and {MOUF} community for hosting at NOOBs Paradise.

Thanks to Valve for the Source SDK.

This map is final.
Please provide feedback on the {MOUF} Community forums at http://www.noobscss.com/ or by email.

This map contains HDR but you can disable it person by person by doing what the text in the team selection screen says.

You MUST use the navigation mesh included for hostages to work correctly.

This map does take some teamwork to rescue all the hostages.

Best if time round is set to 3:00 minutes, but is ok at 2:45.

There is a triggerable hostage zone to help CT's get the objective done. You must clear the  immediate area of all Terrorist and sometimes Counter-terrorists. Just plant and leave the hostage then walk away.

Lots of little things, look for the clues and experiment.

For smaller servers that like to mess around and stuff there is an "admin post" which is an invisible platform on all edges except one. You can only no clip/teleport/fly there.

Keep gravity at the normal level, otherwise you'll miss something great. It will still work, just not as cool.

Please do not rip, decompile or anything else to this level. Thanks.
As this is beta, there may be some issues, please feel free to report any problems you find. The .nav file definately needs tweaking to fix the hostages and bots.

To the d00dz at gmc, Hello! If you like my work, please leave a review or assesment! I am adding more of my maps when i have the time! Subscribe to me to receive notifactions!

------------------ Homepage: www.woomaps.pl/main Server: 88.151.144.73:27015 ------------------ Woo proudly presents.... Cs_lazerclub v4! This map features: -Wicked DJ set! Be your own DJ! -Strobe lighting to confuse your enemy's! -Modeled completly on a nightclub -A .NAV file, so you will never get lost! -All round l33tness! -And much more! Be a CT and try to infiltrate the nightclub and rescue the hostages! Why not stop and knife the T using the DJ set, while he mixes some tunes, and turn off the strobe lights that are confusing your Night Vision! Or be a T and try to stop the CT's from rescuing the hostages! Hide in the toilet and hit them from behind! or why not hide in the shadows or vents and pick them off 1 by one? I have been experimenting with this map, and i have made several 'toys', like the projector and strobe lights and DJ set (very proud off)! Check out some more of my maps on our server!

Counter-Terrorists:
A robbery at a downtown bank has been foiled, but now the terrorsist have taken hostages and have killed at least one.  Infiltrate the bank and either kill all the terrorists or rescue the hostages.


Terrorists:
Kill all the Counter Terrorists and keep them from rescuing the hostages.

KVARTAL - Hostage Rescue Counter terrorists: Rescue the hostages. Take out the Terrorists without jeopardizing the hostages. Terrorists: Prevent Counter-Terrorist force from rescuing the hostages. Other Notes: MADE IN RUSSIA! Credits: Source Version by ~Smith~ Original version by ~Smith~

KUNAR

Hostage Rescue Map for Counter-Strike: Source

CS:GO original map creator: Tanuki
CS:S map port creator: Niko
Navigation Mesh editor: Meurglis3

High-quality port for CS:S of the remarkable samenamed midsize map from CS:GO by Tanuki. This port contains couple of little changes in comparison with the original, which was made for improvement of the gameplay smoothness.

Story:Â 
Â  Â A hostage rescue map on rough terrain. Gameplay is oriented on a single very strong contested area with a smaller side route. This map is great for snipers and those who enjoy outsmarting them.

P.S. ~ Opium and kidnapping brings in eight times as much cash as wheat and uses less water :-)

The name: cs_krizo_beta Game: Counter-Strike Source Players: 32 (16 on 16) The description: Terrorists (al Kaide - it is visible) have grasped enterprise "Кризо" building, ostensibly for this purpose what to steal confidential working out, code-named "Big ***". The militia problem to reject pressure of these terrible perverts, and to return "Big ***" back. Problems of terrorists are not known yet. Hostages on a map are not present, because I have forgotten to add them there :)) the map is not completed, but it is possible to play! Sorry for bad english :P Updated: zm_krizo_beta

Place  the .bsp and the .nav file in C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\your_steam_name\counter-strike source\cstrike\maps
Place the cs_koordinaten folder in 
C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\your_steam_name\counter-strikesource\cstrike\materials

STORY 
In the mountains of northern Afghanistan, is a small village of stone houses nestled up against the base of a mountain. It's early spring, and the snows that cover the mountains have started melting. The stream is still covered in a layer of ice, and just after dawn on this march morning, the air is cold and foggy. The sheep huddle together on the still barren fields, and the soft thunder of the waterfall can be heard from a distance. The village appears abandoned, and the area is quiet. But Terrorists live there, where they grow poppies, and make heroin for sale in the west, and they keep the village for use as a hideout and as a factory for their profits. Unfortunately, a spy has found the village, but he was caught, and is being held hostage in the center of the village. Now, Blackhawk helicopters have landed on the southern edge of town. The Terrorists know that a rescue mission has been launched. 

STRATS 
The approach routes are very carefully timed so that rushes result in conflicts in specific locations. And while the layout is deceptively simple, the number of strategies you can use is almost unlimited. In particular, how you split your teams will greatly affect the game play. 

The map's layout is a cyclone model with both teams spaced equidistant from the hostages, and rushing to a center arena. The village is constructed so that the terrorists come in either straight or to the high side, and the CT's either straight and to the low side. Both can flank the other team within the village, or by the ground route around the village. You can get in and out of the buildings, and easily onto the roofs, and there are at least three different ways into the village center for each team. This layout creates the effect of the teams coming out of the woodwork in a central arena, if they both sprint to the center. The teams can also try to flank the low route outside the village, and the timing is set so that smokes, flashes, and snipers all play in that tactic. 

Most of the routes that are interesting require you to break down a door or window, and this includes getting the hostages. The sound gives away your location. 

The web site has a full list of the different strats that I used to plan the game play.

Since cs_kismayo was so well received by the css community, I felt I should release a new version featuring HDR.  

A few small glitches and exploitable areas in the map were also fixed.  Also, this version features improved bot AI and place names.  The map still runs as fast and smoothly as the normal version.

Please enjoy this map and look for my other maps.  The final version of another one of my maps, cs_symphony, was just released.  So go give it a shot.  Also, check out my map in progress, de_zenith, and give me feedback or suggestions for the final version of it.  Thank you for all of your support.

Peace,
Oreo
jazzbassking@hotmail.com

I am adding this map again because an admin deleted the old one I had uploaded.  His reasoning was because the cs_kismayoHDR version was a newer, superior version so it should take the place of cs_kismayo.  This is flawed logic because not every server wants to run the HDR version.  Also, people already have the cs_kismayo version and do not want to switch.  So, I uploaded the map again.  Please do not delete it this time because it has been requested multiple times for me to re upload it.

There are a few places to sneak around like in vents or in sniping positions.

Although the few bugs are not too apparent they dont cause any real problems.  


 Use this map for whatever you want, for servers or for anything else.

CS_KAP9_HOUSE by kvackabill (released April 2010)

The map is a remake of my house. I started working on it years ago and decided to finish it after a long hiatus. The environment outside the house isn't a realistic image of the real world but more of a stripped down version.
For obvious reasons I couldn't do the whole environment surrounding the house.
...Also more cover added in some places.

About Playing with Bots: More or less playable NAV-file is included in archive.

Happy Frags and Good Luck!

This is a highly detailed hostage rescue map. It has been very popular on my server ever since I released it for beta testing. People always extend it for several hours and say that by gameplay and detail it is better than cs_compound and de_port. Well, you be the judge. Download the map and see for yourself. 
Some of the fun stuff in the map: breakable walls, secret places and hiding/sniping spots, a hydraulic press that can be used to crash people, a toggleable light in the hostage building; it can also be shot out. Besides that you have very detailed graphics and loads of strategies and approach areas around the map. Have fun. Hope you enjoy it. P.S. Leave your comments about the map here or e-mail me at klevenskiy@gmail.com please.

CS_Jungle - by Shiroko ([shiroko@dune2k.com](mailto:shiroko@dune2k.com)) =========================================== Newest version always available at:
[http://faq.dune2k.com/cs_jungle.html](http://faq.dune2k.com/cs_jungle.html "") ### Version 0.1 - Beta, first release:
  • This is the first release of the map, my tests with bots show it is working though several adjustments should be made for improvement. Known issues:
  • Bots lag the map seriously.
  • Hostages require some guidance in order not to lose them on your way.
  • Bridge might cause some problems.
  • I would like comments on FPS issues in the map (Runs fine on my Ti4200, with fps similar to dust2 and compound). E-Mail me at [shiroko@dune2k.com](mailto:shiroko@dune2k.com). ### Version 0.2 - Beta
  • Bridge made static, I was dreaming anyway.
  • Added some clip brushes to prevent players from getting stuck in walls in the middle of firefights.
  • Bots still lag, if anyone could point a solution it would be nice.
  • Fixed some bad texture alignments.
  • Edit nav area names in radar map, sorry for the silly names, they're are limited to what's available.
  • Removed the func\_dustmotes in the meanwhile because they were causing a bug that made all the muzzle flashes, smoke and explosions invisible. ### Version 0.3 - Beta
  • Added occluders, FPS is up to 15% higher in some critical spots, but more than that I couldn't do.
  • Nav file fixed, it's not 400k instead of 2MB and fixes hostage movement (They won't dance around the garage and follow better in the woods) and also eliminates the bot lag. Bots can now be added freely (Well, as free as in any other map) and they now know the paths to all hostages and the path from the overpass (Though, they're don't seem to use it)
  • Fixed the rocks that were standing in air on the ledge of the cliff
  • Blocked some areas that let you get on the cliffs (Special thanks to games for finding some weird spots)
  • Added an Easter egg, as a signature for people that get the map without a readme.
  • Fixed some invalid CT spawns, map not officially supports 40 players (If anyone actually manages to get so much players on a server, I'd like a mail about that)
  • Fixed some points of awful mapping techniques, nothing you'll notice but took down vis time for compiling and I think it's more fair in the balance of things... ### Version 0.4 - Last Beta?
  • Nav file improvements, bots still don't use overpass (They know it, but unless following a human, they don't like this path), Hostages problems solved a little, but seems no matter what I'll do you have to wait and give them time to catch, as they simply cannot keep in pace with a player, otherwise they preform good (Just make sure you give them a sec to figure when they need to jump).
  • Clipped some odd areas once more, and all the horizontal trees so you can stand on them.
  • Made the invisible blocks less apparent, APC in CT spawn and a tree to block some of the river passage
  • Overview added for the 3 people that might actually use it, the rest now have to download an extra 1.3M cause of the overview texture.
  • Fixed a bug where one CT spawn was outside the buy zone ### Version 1.0 - Final release (Or is it?)
  • Fixed a lot of plants that were actually hovering.
  • Made the beam in the T Spawn stairs illusionary, so you can get stuck in it.
  • Added a cubemap for the APC
  • Rounded one of the rough cliffs.
  • A few other pointless things.
  • Unless something critical happens to this release this would be final one. If you still want to comment, you're welcome, it'll just have less of an effect like that. ### A few basic strategies to keep in mind:
  • Move slowly in the forests unless you're in a rush, it's very easy to miss people hiding in the shadows.
  • Which points the next thing, use the shadows and the bushes in the jungle, don't move on the road in the middle. You can frequently kill someone from behind because he passed you without noticing
  • Terrorists have a camping advantage, if they use it the CTs can always use the overpass for sniping them (Use the area with the bushes, not the exposed area, it is meant only to avoid damage when going down)
  • When sniping hide in foliage and don't move, moving is the most exposing thing. (Until someone saw you, then you better move if you don't want to get hit)
  • If you go for hostages, try letting two people get them, each from one house. This will simplify bringing them back. Remember there are two Hostage rescues, so if you suspect someone camping the rescue, go to the farther one. All models and textures were created by me, but can be used by any other mapper for his map freely. As long that he doesn't make any profit of this work. In the later case, E-Mail me at shiroko@dune2k.com for resolving the issue. Also in both cases, credit should still be given to me. In case anyone wants the source file of the art he's welcome to E-Mail me (Again, [shiroko@dune2k.com](mailto:shiroko@dune2k.com)) The following textures are not original work, and therefore are free for any use:
  • dirt01, mud01, cliff05a, cliff05b, grass01. Omer Sturlovich
    Shiroko
    [shiroko@dune2k.com](mailto:shiroko@dune2k.com)

Map: Jalalabad
Game: Counter-Strike Source
Game mode: Hostage Rescue
Players: 2-64
Map info:

Terrorists want to execute foreign journalists. Counter-Terrorists must stop their plan.


Install:

Copy files mapname.bsp, mapname.nav, mapname.txt;

Paste files in Counter-strike Source folder, example - "C:\Program Files\Steam\steamapps\YOUR_ACCOUNT_NAME\counter-strike source\cstrike\maps".

The terrorists aim to kill the counter-terrorists, which appears logical.

This is an optimized version of cs_italy_reloaded. In this new version, FPS are usually between 50 and 80 on my computer (around the same as official map for me) instead of 20 to 50 before optimization.
There are still little freezing time but in the first round only. 
Special thanks to SoopaFly, DJ Bourgeoisie (cs/de_xcom, de_courthouse_final...), LDuke and PAF team (from http://www.punkassfraggers.com) for their help and all the time they have spent to optimized this map. Thanks too to Boxer82003 for testing!

Action take place in a little village in italy, just before night. Counters have to rescue hostages which have been hidden in a little house by terrorists.
This is NOT a remake of cs_italy; it is a 100% new map made with part of cs_italy textures and style.
You can play up to 40 players.description
